A reaction engineer analyzing a recycle PFR might need to solve the DAEs shown in equations (1) through (6) using the initial values and stopping criterion shown in @tbl-apndx_K_3_2_initial_values. Specifically, the engineer might need to calculate $\dot{n}_{A,in}$, $\dot{n}_{Z,in}$, $T_{in}$, $\dot{n}_A\big\vert_{z=L}$, $\dot{n}_Z\big\vert_{z=L}$, and $T\big\vert_{z=L}$. The rate expression, equation (7), is known as are the following quantities: $D$ = 5 cm, $\Delta H$ = -14,000 cal mol^-1^, $\dot{V}$ = 1150 cm^3^ min^-1^, $\breve{C}_p$ = 1.3 cal cm^-3^ K^-1^, $R_R$ = 1.3, $\dot{n}_{A,feed}$ = 1.0 mol min^-1^, $L$ = 50 cm, $T_{feed}$ = 300 K, $k_0$ = 4.2 x 10^15^ cm^3^ mol^-1^ min^-1^, and $E$ = 18,000 cal mol^-1^.

$$
\frac{d\dot{n}_A}{dz} = - \frac{\pi D^2}{4}r \tag{1}
$$

$$
\frac{d\dot{n}_Z}{dz} =  \frac{\pi D^2}{4}r \tag{2}
$$

$$
\frac{dT}{dz} = - \frac{\pi D^2}{4}\frac{r\Delta H}{\dot{V} \breve{C}_p} \tag{3}
$$

$$
\dot{n}_{feed,A} + \frac{R_R}{1+R_R}\dot{n}_A\big\vert_{z=L} - \dot{n}_{A,in}  = 0 \tag{4}
$$

$$
\frac{R_R}{1+R_R} \dot{n}_Z\big\vert_{z=L} - \dot{n}_{Z,in}  = 0 \tag{5}
$$

$$
T_{in} - T_{feed} - R_R\left( T\big\vert_{z=L} - T_{in} \right) = 0 \tag{6}
$$

$$
r = k_0 \exp{\left( \frac{-E}{RT} \right)}\frac{\dot{n}_A\dot{n}_Z}{\dot{V}^2} \tag{7}
$$

| Variable | Initial Value | Stopping Criterion |
|:------:|:-------:|:-------:|
| $z$ | $0$ | $L$ |
| $\dot{n}_A$ | $\dot{n}_{A,in}$ | |
| $\dot{n}_Z$ | $\dot{n}_{Z,in}$ | |
| $T$ | $T_{in}$ | |
  
: Initial values and stopping criterion for solving the IVODEs, equations (1) through (3). {#tbl-apndx_K_3_2_initial_values}
